intro: Jungia seleriana, commonly known as the white wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forests and stream banks. It has a trailing or spreading growth habit and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Jungia seleriana is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
